solution_line_template: The flashlight was {flashlight_percentage} of the price of the hoodie, so {hoodie_cost} * {flashlight_percentage} = $<<{hoodie_cost}*{flashlight_percentage}={flashlight_cost}>>{flashlight_cost}.
The promotion for a pair of boots was {original_boots_cost} * {promotion_percentage} = $<<{original_boots_cost}*{promotion_percentage}={promotion_discount}>>{promotion_discount}.
So the pair of boots cost {original_boots_cost} - {promotion_discount} = $<<{original_boots_cost}-{promotion_discount}={final_boots_cost}>>{final_boots_cost}.
Celina therefore spent {hoodie_cost} + {flashlight_cost} + {final_boots_cost} = $<<{hoodie_cost}+{flashlight_cost}+{final_boots_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} on the equipment.
